data.event: Ontario's education minister said Friday she's ready to write regulations compelling school boards to share vacant space with other school boards and community partners.

The report was released by Wynne Friday, and contains 21 recommendations for the Ontario government to help school boards and communities understand and deal with the impact of fewer school-aged children in the province.

Thames Valley District School Board chair James Stewart admitted in a weekend e-mail the devil on the implementation of the report's recommendations would be in the detail of any regulations Wynne issues.
